data.name: Sack of Campeachy
data.desc: Capt de Graaf and Grammont lead assault on Campeachy
data.agents_sp: Felipe de la Barrera y Villegas, Capt Cristóbal Martínez de Acevedo, Gov Juan Bruno de Téllez de Guzmán, Adm Andrés de Ochoa y Zárate
data.agents_nsp0: Capt de Graaf, Capt Grammon, Capt Willems, Capt Andrieszoon, George Bannister, Pierre Bot 10 Ships 6 Sloops 17 PA 700 men
data.agents_nsp1: Capt David Mitchell of HMS Ruby
data.note:
Jan 1685 Curaçao. Gov refuses buccaneers under de Graaf entry, after which they head to Hon [Sp Hon?] to plan attacks on Sp; is joined by more buccaneers inc Andrieszoon, Grammont, Willems, and up to 20 other Capts / Jun 1685 Hon or Sp Hon. Graaf and Grammont 6 Ships 6 Sloops 17 PA 4 sm Vessels 700 men towards Cape Catoche / 6 Jul-Sep 1685 Campeachy taken /v Latimer 252-255
 Possibly see 1685 Castillo de San Felipe attacked by Pirate Juan Zanques /v Lujan 2 108
 Possibly see 1685 Golfo Dulce. Vars parties of pirates enter R Dulce, R Montague /v Zamora 178
 Possibly see 1685 Golfo Dulce. Juan Zanques and his men enter Golfo Dulce, Bodegas, Verapaz, reach Lunrub and kidnap an Indian /v Rodriguez C 47 /GUATEMALA,280 [Pres a Rey a 27 feb 1685]
 1685 Guat. Pir enter Golfo Dulce in 21 PA, head to Verapaz /v Garcia P 2 121
 1684-1685 Old R. Nicholas van Horn, Dutch buccaneer, spends sm months logging at Hon, then leads or participates in 1685 Sack of Campeachy /v Joseph C 74-76 /1163 CSPC 11 [Jul 1683] /339 CSPC 12 [Aug 1685] /Blathwayt vol 25 [Molesworth to Blathwayt 4 May 1686]
